cheatsheet.title: Creating, building and deploying application to OpenShift

intro.description: This cheat sheet will guide you through creating, building and deploying an application to Openshift.

item.title: Start CDK/Minishift
item.description: Follow these steps to start CDK/Minishift in Eclipse

subitem.label: On local tool bar press 'Start the server' button
Wait until virtual machine is running
Accept the untrusted SSL certificate to connect to OpenShift cluster

item.title: Create an OpenShift Application
item.description: Follow these steps to create, build, and deploy the application

subitem.label: Select 'New->Application...' from context menu for root node
Select 'nodejs-mongo-persistent' project from 'Server application source' list and press 'Next' button.
On 'Template Parameters' page, press 'Finish' button to create OpenShift application.
When 'Create Application Summary' dialog box displays, press 'OK' button.
When 'Import OpenShift Application' dialog box displays, press 'Finish' button.
When request to create server adapter for new application dialog box displays, press 'Yes' button.

item.title: Wait Application built and deployed
item.description: When the application is finished building and deploying you should see two running pods in OpenShift Explorer View.

item.title: Open Application home page in browser
item.description: At this point, you've successfully created, built and deployed a Node.js and MongoDB application in containers running on OpenShift in your personal OpenShift cluster. From context menu for 'My Project' node in OpenShift Explorer tree select 'Show In->Web Browser' to see your Application home page in browser.
